{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3740614,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-16T17:22:22.077Z","cooked":"

Hi everybody,

we make a lot of parts and assemblies, but we don’t have a good way to store them. some of them can fit in various sterilite-type bins on shelves, but many parts are too large for that.

I’m looking for ideas for better organizing work in progress. we can’t leave anything out in classroom spaces between sessions, it all has to go in the storeroom.

eh?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-16T17:22:22.077Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":69.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506344,"topic_slug":"organizing-work-in-progress","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/organizing-work-in-progress/506344/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3740636,"name":"David Allred","username":"D.Allred","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/df705f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-16T17:55:23.236Z","cooked":"

Could you use build tables on wheels?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-16T17:55:23.236Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":56.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506344,"topic_slug":"organizing-work-in-progress","display_username":"David Allred","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12651,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4451 CAD Mentor and Coach"},"post_url":"/t/organizing-work-in-progress/506344/2","custom_user_title":"4451 CAD Mentor and Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3740702,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-16T19:45:57.545Z","cooked":"

no, it’s a classroom space, it must be left without any robotics stuff in it at all. the storeroom is about ten feet square, full of shelving, which is about half full of parts, like fasteners, motors, gears, etc, and about half full of projects in various states of completion, but in quite a disorganized arrangement. we have room to park two or maybe three completed robots, but these parking spaces are always full of last year’s robot, the drivetrain we use for camera and trajectory work, etc.

do other teams have some sort of “storage czar” to keep spaces like this organized?

we also have quite a luxurious machine shop space, but, again, it’s full of machine tools, not the sort of work racks you might see in a factory setting. does anyone do that?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-16T19:45:57.545Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":20.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506344,"topic_slug":"organizing-work-in-progress","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/organizing-work-in-progress/506344/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3740711,"name":"Nick.kremer","username":"Nick.kremer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nick.kremer/{size}/174932_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-16T19:56:03.405Z","cooked":"

The large totes that the kit of parts come in are nice for this, or totes you can get from the hardware store. Add some labels on the top/sides for extra points.

yeah, that’s one of our standard answers too, though the totes tend to mix together “important small thing” and “random big thing” in a sort of soup.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-16T20:09:01.278Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":85,"readers_count":84,"score":27.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506344,"topic_slug":"organizing-work-in-progress","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19714,"username":"Nick.kremer","name":"Nick.kremer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nick.kremer/{size}/174932_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/organizing-work-in-progress/506344/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3740747,"name":"Nick.kremer","username":"Nick.kremer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nick.kremer/{size}/174932_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-16T20:49:03.112Z","cooked":"

We tend to use a mix of the large totes, the smaller sterlite type bins, and McMaster Part bags all with labels. Works out pretty well for keeping us organized in addition to a good part tracking spreadsheet/software who’s usage is none negotiable.

I just remembered I have a older open alliance post where I talk about this in more detail:

Spartatroniks 3512 - Build Blog 2022 FRC Open Alliance
Design → Machining → Assembly I wanted to detail how 3512 produces the parts for our robots, and the process and tools that make that job more manageable. Part Numbers Like many teams, we use unique part numbers to identify every part our team designs. I’ve written a detailed guide on part naming schemes on our CAD Training site, but here are a few examples: 21-000-000 21-DRT-102 It doesn’t really matter what naming scheme you use, but be consistent and use one! Part Tracking Spreadsheet We…

My team uses what we call a ‘finished parts rack’ where we have basically shelves on wheels where we store finished parts that need to go on the robot or need to be assembled. The idea can probably be adapted to work in progress stuff.
